meanings.definition: Covered in or full of small bumps or protuberances
meanings.sent1: The cat's fur felt popply to the touch.
meanings.sent2: The lizard's skin was popply, helping it blend into the rocky terrain.
meanings.sent3: The popply surface of the sponge made washing dishes more fun.
meanings.sent4: The popply texture of the ceiling gave the room a cozy feel.
meanings.sent5: The popply leaves rustled in the wind, creating a soothing sound.

meanings.definition: To make a light, popping sound
meanings.sent1: When I squeezed the toy, it popplyed loudly.
meanings.sent2: The popcorn popplyed in the microwave, filling the kitchen with a delicious smell.
meanings.sent3: The bubble wrap popplyed as I jumped on it, making me giggle.
meanings.sent4: The firewood popplyed in the fireplace, warming the room.
meanings.sent5: The raindrops popplyed on the roof, lulling me to sleep.

meanings.definition: A type of flower with a papery texture
meanings.sent1: The bouquet was filled with beautiful popplys.
meanings.sent2: She pressed the delicate popply in her journal to preserve its beauty.
meanings.sent3: The garden was full of colorful popplys swaying in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: The artist painted a field of popplys in vibrant hues.
meanings.sent5: The popplys in the vase brightened up the room with their cheerful colors.
